Package gui

Class AbstractController

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.AbstractController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SceneSetter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ApproveChangesController, ApproveGradeController, ChooseReportTypeController, ClientConnectionController, CreateQuestionController, CreateTestController, ExecuteTestController, HodMenuController, LecturerMenuController, LecturerStaticsReportController, LecturerTestViewController, LoginController, ManualTestController, OnlineTestController, QuestionTableController, RunningTestController, ShowGradeController, ShowStudentTestController, ShowTestDataController, StartTestController, StudentMenuController
    public abstract class AbstractController
extends java.lang.Object
implements SceneSetter
    The AbstractController class is an abstract class that serves as a base class for other controller classes in the GUI package. It implements the SceneSetter interface and provides common methods and fields used by the controllers.

      • start

        public void start​(java.lang.String fxmlName,
                  java.lang.String prevScreen)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Starts the controller by setting the FXML name and previous screen, and loading the FXML file.
        Parameters:
        fxmlName - the name of the FXML file
        prevScreen - the name of the previous screen
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs during the loading of the FXML file

      • backBtn

        public void backBtn​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Handles the action event when the back button is clicked. It hides the current window and displays the previous screen.
        Parameters:
        event - the action event
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs during the display of the previous screen
